properties.name: domain_name
properties.description: A domain name for which the certificate should be issued

properties.name: domain_name
properties.description: A domain name for which the certificate should be issued

properties.name: subject_alternative_names
properties.description: A list of domains that should be SANs in the issued certificate

properties.name: validation_method
properties.description: Which method to use for validation. DNS or EMAIL are valid, NONE can be used for certificates that were imported into ACM and then into Terraform.

properties.name: private_key
properties.description: The certificate's PEM-formatted private key

properties.name: private_key
properties.description: The certificate's PEM-formatted private key

properties.name: certificate_body
properties.description: The certificate's PEM-formatted public key

properties.name: certificate_chain
properties.description: The certificate's PEM-formatted chain

properties.name: tags
properties.description: A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.

properties.name: certificate_arn
properties.description: The ARN of the certificate that is being validated.

properties.name: validation_record_fqdns
properties.description: List of FQDNs that implement the validation. Only valid for DNS validation method ACM certificates. If this is set, the resource can implement additional sanity checks and has an explicit dependency on the resource that is implementing the validation

properties.name: certificate_authority_configuration
properties.description: Nested argument containing algorithms and certificate subject information. Defined below.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: Whether the certificate authority is enabled or disabled. Defaults to true.

properties.name: revocation_configuration
properties.description: Nested argument containing revocation configuration. Defined below.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: Specifies a key-value map of user-defined tags that are attached to the certificate authority.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The type of the certificate authority. Currently, this must be SUBORDINATE.

properties.name: permanent_deletion_time_in_days
properties.description: The number of days to make a CA restorable after it has been deleted, must be between 7 to 30 days, with default to 30 days.

properties.name: cloudwatch_role_arn
properties.description: The ARN of an IAM role for CloudWatch (to allow logging & monitoring

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of the API key

properties.name: description
properties.description: The API key description. Defaults to "Managed by Terraform".

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: Specifies whether the API key can be used by callers. Defaults to true.

properties.name: value
properties.description: The value of the API key. If not specified, it will be automatically generated by AWS on creation.

properties.name: authorizer_uri
properties.description: The authorizer's Uniform Resource Identifier (URI

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of the authorizer

properties.name: rest_api_id
properties.description: The ID of the associated REST API

properties.name: identity_source
properties.description: The source of the identity in an incoming request. Defaults to method.request.header.Authorization. For REQUEST type, this may be a comma-separated list of values, including headers, query string parameters and stage variables - e.g. "method.request.header.SomeHeaderName,method.request.querystring.SomeQueryStringName,stageVariables.SomeStageVariableName"

properties.name: type
properties.description: The type of the authorizer. Possible values are TOKEN for a Lambda function using a single authorization token submitted in a custom header, REQUEST for a Lambda function using incoming request parameters, or COGNITO_USER_POOLS for using an Amazon Cognito user pool. Defaults to TOKEN.

properties.name: authorizer_credentials
properties.description:
The credentials required for the authorizer.
To specify an IAM Role for API Gateway to assume, use the IAM Role ARN.

properties.name: authorizer_result_ttl_in_seconds
properties.description: The TTL of cached authorizer results in seconds. Defaults to 300.

properties.name: identity_validation_expression
properties.description: A validation expression for the incoming identity. For TOKEN type, this value should be a regular expression. The incoming token from the client is matched against this expression, and will proceed if the token matches. If the token doesn't match, the client receives a 401 Unauthorized response.

properties.name: provider_arns
properties.description: A list of the Amazon Cognito user pool ARNs. Each element is of this format: arn:aws:cognito-idp:{region}:{account_id}:userpool/{user_pool_id}.

properties.name: domain_name
properties.description: The already-registered domain name to connect the API to.

properties.name: api_id
properties.description: The id of the API to connect.

properties.name: stage_name
properties.description: The name of a specific deployment stage to expose at the given path. If omitted, callers may select any stage by including its name as a path element after the base path.

properties.name: base_path
properties.description: Path segment that must be prepended to the path when accessing the API via this mapping. If omitted, the API is exposed at the root of the given domain.

properties.name: description
properties.description: The description of the client certificate.

properties.name: rest_api_id
properties.description: The ID of the associated REST API

properties.name: stage_name
properties.description: The name of the stage. If the specified stage already exists, it will be updated to point to the new deployment. If the stage does not exist, a new one will be created and point to this deployment.

properties.name: description
properties.description: The description of the deployment

properties.name: stage_description
properties.description: The description of the stage

properties.name: variables
properties.description: A map that defines variables for the stage

properties.name: location
properties.description: The location of the targeted API entity of the to-be-created documentation part. See below.

properties.name: properties
properties.description: A content map of API-specific key-value pairs describing the targeted API entity. The map must be encoded as a JSON string, e.g., "{ \"description\": \"The API does ...\" }". Only Swagger-compliant key-value pairs can be exported and, hence, published.

properties.name: rest_api_id
properties.description: The ID of the associated Rest API

properties.name: version
properties.description: The version identifier of the API documentation snapshot.

properties.name: rest_api_id
properties.description: The ID of the associated Rest API

properties.name: description
properties.description: The description of the API documentation version.

properties.name: domain_name
properties.description: The fully-qualified domain name to register

properties.name: endpoint_configuration
properties.description: Configuration block defining API endpoint information including type. Defined below.

properties.name: rest_api_id
properties.description: The string identifier of the associated REST API.

properties.name: response_type
properties.description: The response type of the associated GatewayResponse.

properties.name: status_code
properties.description: The HTTP status code of the Gateway Response.

properties.name: response_parameters
properties.description: A map specifying the templates used to transform the response body.

properties.name: response_templates
properties.description: A map specifying the parameters (paths, query strings and headers

properties.name: rest_api_id
properties.description: The ID of the associated REST API.

properties.name: resource_id
properties.description: The API resource ID.

properties.name: http_method
properties.description: The HTTP method (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, HEAD, OPTION, ANY

properties.name: integration_http_method
properties.description: The integration HTTP method (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, HEAD, OPTION

properties.name: type
properties.description: The integration input's type. Valid values are HTTP (for HTTP backends

properties.name: connection_type
properties.description: The integration input's connectionType. Valid values are INTERNET (default for connections through the public routable internet

properties.name: connection_id
properties.description: The id of the VpcLink used for the integration. Required if connection_type is VPC_LINK

properties.name: uri
properties.description: The input's URI. Required if type is AWS, AWS_PROXY, HTTP or HTTP_PROXY. For HTTP integrations, the URI must be a fully formed, encoded HTTP(S

properties.name: credentials
properties.description: The credentials required for the integration. For AWS integrations, 2 options are available. To specify an IAM Role for Amazon API Gateway to assume, use the role's ARN. To require that the caller's identity be passed through from the request, specify the string arn:aws:iam::\*:user/\*.

properties.name: request_templates
properties.description: A map of the integration's request templates.

properties.name: request_parameters
properties.description: A map of request query string parameters and headers that should be passed to the backend responder. For example: request_parameters = { "integration.request.header.X-Some-Other-Header" = "method.request.header.X-Some-Header" }

properties.name: passthrough_behavior
properties.description: The integration passthrough behavior (WHEN_NO_MATCH, WHEN_NO_TEMPLATES, NEVER

properties.name: cache_key_parameters
properties.description: A list of cache key parameters for the integration.

properties.name: cache_namespace
properties.description: The integration's cache namespace.

properties.name: content_handling
properties.description: Specifies how to handle request payload content type conversions. Supported values are CONVERT_TO_BINARY and CONVERT_TO_TEXT. If this property is not defined, the request payload will be passed through from the method request to integration request without modification, provided that the passthroughBehaviors is configured to support payload pass-through.

properties.name: timeout_milliseconds
properties.description: Custom timeout between 50 and 29,000 milliseconds. The default value is 29,000 milliseconds.

properties.name: rest_api_id
properties.description: The ID of the associated REST API

properties.name: resource_id
properties.description: The API resource ID

properties.name: http_method
properties.description: The HTTP method (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, HEAD, OPTIONS, ANY

properties.name: status_code
properties.description: The HTTP status code

properties.name: selection_pattern
properties.description: Specifies the regular expression pattern used to choose an integration response based on the response from the backend. Setting this to - makes the integration the default one. If the backend is an AWS Lambda function, the AWS Lambda function error header is matched. For all other HTTP and AWS backends, the HTTP status code is matched.

properties.name: response_templates
properties.description: A map specifying the templates used to transform the integration response body

properties.name: response_parameters
properties.description: A map of response parameters that can be read from the backend response. For example: response_parameters = { "method.response.header.X-Some-Header" = "integration.response.header.X-Some-Other-Header" }

properties.name: content_handling
properties.description: Specifies how to handle request payload content type conversions. Supported values are CONVERT_TO_BINARY and CONVERT_TO_TEXT. If this property is not defined, the response payload will be passed through from the integration response to the method response without modification.

properties.name: rest_api_id
properties.description: The ID of the associated REST API

properties.name: resource_id
properties.description: The API resource ID

properties.name: http_method
properties.description: The HTTP Method (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, HEAD, OPTIONS, ANY

properties.name: authorization
properties.description: The type of authorization used for the method (NONE, CUSTOM, AWS_IAM, COGNITO_USER_POOLS

properties.name: authorizer_id
properties.description: The authorizer id to be used when the authorization is CUSTOM or COGNITO_USER_POOLS

properties.name: authorization_scopes
properties.description: The authorization scopes used when the authorization is COGNITO_USER_POOLS

properties.name: api_key_required
properties.description: Specify if the method requires an API key

properties.name: request_models
properties.description: A map of the API models used for the request's content type where key is the content type (e.g. application/json

properties.name: request_validator_id
properties.description: The ID of a aws_api_gateway_request_validator

properties.name: request_parameters
properties.description: A map of request query string parameters and headers that should be passed to the integration. For example: request_parameters = {"method.request.header.X-Some-Header" = true "method.request.querystring.some-query-param" = true} would define that the header X-Some-Header and the query string some-query-param must be provided in the request

properties.name: rest_api_id
properties.description: The ID of the associated REST API

properties.name: resource_id
properties.description: The API resource ID

properties.name: http_method
properties.description: The HTTP Method (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, HEAD, OPTIONS, ANY

properties.name: status_code
properties.description: The HTTP status code

properties.name: response_models
properties.description: A map of the API models used for the response's content type

properties.name: response_parameters
properties.description: A map of response parameters that can be sent to the caller. For example: response_parameters = { "method.response.header.X-Some-Header" = true } would define that the header X-Some-Header can be provided on the response.

properties.name: rest_api_id
properties.description: The ID of the REST API

properties.name: stage_name
properties.description: The name of the stage

properties.name: method_path
properties.description: Method path defined as {resource_path}/{http_method} for an individual method override, or */* for overriding all methods in the stage.

properties.name: settings
properties.description: The settings block, see below.

properties.name: rest_api_id
properties.description: The ID of the associated REST API

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of the model

properties.name: description
properties.description: The description of the model

properties.name: content_type
properties.description: The content type of the model

properties.name: schema
properties.description: The schema of the model in a JSON form

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of the request validator

properties.name: rest_api_id
properties.description: The ID of the associated Rest API

properties.name: validate_request_body
properties.description: Boolean whether to validate request body. Defaults to false.

properties.name: validate_request_parameters
properties.description: Boolean whether to validate request parameters. Defaults to false.

properties.name: rest_api_id
properties.description: The ID of the associated REST API

properties.name: parent_id
properties.description: The ID of the parent API resource

properties.name: path_part
properties.description: The last path segment of this API resource.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of the REST API

properties.name: description
properties.description: The description of the REST API

properties.name: endpoint_configuration
properties.description: Nested argument defining API endpoint configuration including endpoint type. Defined below.

properties.name: binary_media_types
properties.description: The list of binary media types supported by the RestApi. By default, the RestApi supports only UTF-8-encoded text payloads.

properties.name: minimum_compression_size
properties.description: Minimum response size to compress for the REST API. Integer between -1 and 10485760 (10MB

properties.name: body
properties.description: An OpenAPI specification that defines the set of routes and integrations to create as part of the REST API.

properties.name: policy
properties.description: JSON formatted policy document that controls access to the API Gateway. For more information about building AWS IAM policy documents with Terraform, see the AWS IAM Policy Document Guide

properties.name: api_key_source
properties.description: The source of the API key for requests. Valid values are HEADER (default

properties.name: rest_api_id
properties.description: The ID of the associated REST API

properties.name: stage_name
properties.description: The name of the stage

properties.name: deployment_id
properties.description: The ID of the deployment that the stage points to

properties.name: access_log_settings
properties.description: Enables access logs for the API stage. Detailed below.

properties.name: cache_cluster_enabled
properties.description: Specifies whether a cache cluster is enabled for the stage

properties.name: cache_cluster_size
properties.description: The size of the cache cluster for the stage, if enabled. Allowed values include 0.5, 1.6, 6.1, 13.5, 28.4, 58.2, 118 and 237.

properties.name: client_certificate_id
properties.description: The identifier of a client certificate for the stage.

properties.name: description
properties.description: The description of the stage

properties.name: documentation_version
properties.description: The version of the associated API documentation

properties.name: variables
properties.description: A map that defines the stage variables

properties.name: tags
properties.description: A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.

properties.name: xray_tracing_enabled
properties.description: Whether active tracing with X-ray is enabled. Defaults to false.
